title: Graph of electric field along a vertical path

content.description: Two spheres with charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are positioned a distance <math alttext="2 lowercase d" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> apart, as shown. Points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="uppercase D" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are labeled. The dashed line connecting <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="uppercase D" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> bisects the line joining the two spheres.
content.question: Which of the following graphs best represents the net electric potential <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of position along a straight path from point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="uppercase D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Position, and the values B and uppercase D are indicated along it from left to right. The vertical axis is labeled V, and 0 is indicated at the bottom of the axis. The curve begins roughly horizontal on the vertical axis above B, and curves downward and to the right. It levels off and becomes horizontal as it passes above the midpoint between values B and uppercase D, then curves upward and to the right. The curve ends roughly horizontally as it passes above uppercase D at the same height as the curve began at.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Position, and the values B and uppercase D are indicated along it from left to right. The vertical axis is labeled V, and 0 is indicated at the bottom of the axis. The curve begins roughly horizontal on the vertical axis above B, near the bottom of the vertical axis, and curves upward and to the right. The curve begins to level off after it passes above the midpoint between values B and uppercase D. The curve ends roughly horizontally as it passes above uppercase D, near the top of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Position, and the values B and uppercase D are indicated along it from left to right. The vertical axis is labeled V, and 0 is indicated at the bottom of the axis. The curve begins roughly horizontal on the vertical axis above B, and curves upward and to the right. It levels off and becomes horizontal as it passes above the midpoint between values B and uppercase D, then curves downward and to the right. The curve ends roughly horizontally as it passes above uppercase D at the same height as the curve began at.

The vertical axis is labeled V, and 0 is indicated at the bottom of the axis. The curve begins to level off after it passes above the midpoint between values B and uppercase D. The curve ends roughly horizontally as it passes above uppercase D, near the bottom of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Position, and the values B and uppercase D are indicated along it from left to right. The vertical axis is labeled V, and 0 is indicated at the bottom of the axis. The line begins on the vertical axis above B, slants horizontally to the right, and ends as it passes above uppercase D at the same height as the curve began at.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Position, and the values B and uppercase D are indicated along it from left to right. The vertical axis is labeled V, and 0 is indicated at the bottom of the axis. The curve begins roughly horizontal on the vertical axis above B, and curves upward and to the right. It levels off and becomes horizontal as it passes above the midpoint between values B and uppercase D, then curves downward and to the right. The curve ends roughly horizontally as it passes above uppercase D at the same height as the curve began at.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
